trans-unit.source: IDS Connector

seg-source.mrk: IDS Connector

trans-unit.source: The IDS Connector is the connection between Microsoft Dynamics NAV and wholesaler Webshops. This topic provides an overview of the communication process and then describes how to use IDS in cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: The IDS Connector is the connection between Microsoft Dynamics NAV and wholesaler Webshops.
This topic provides an overview of the communication process and then describes how to use IDS in cc|project.

trans-unit.source: Communication Process Overview

seg-source.mrk: Communication Process Overview

trans-unit.source: To better understand the communication between Microsoft Dynamics NAV and the Webshops, the process is described here.

seg-source.mrk: To better understand the communication between Microsoft Dynamics NAV and the Webshops, the process is described here.

trans-unit.source: First, an HTML file with certain parameters must be created and invoked to attract the Webshop of the wholesaler by IDS. This file sends the parameters by HTTP to the wholesaler’s Webshop and opens their Webshop.

seg-source.mrk: First, an HTML file with certain parameters must be created and invoked to attract the Webshop of the wholesaler by IDS.
This file sends the parameters by HTTP to the wholesaler’s Webshop and opens their Webshop.

trans-unit.source: Next, the Webshop creates a shopping cart or button in the Webshop (e.g. “IDS Transfer”) sent as an order to the return address, that includes all the data of the shopping basket. The return address is the starting point of the tunnel service for WebHook return (e.g. ngrok). There, the data arrives and are sent through the tunnel to the IDS connector.

seg-source.mrk: Next, the Webshop creates a shopping cart or button in the Webshop (e.g. “IDS Transfer”) sent as an order to the return address, that includes all the data of the shopping basket.
The return address is the starting point of the tunnel service for WebHook return (e.g. ngrok).
There, the data arrives and are sent through the tunnel to the IDS connector.

trans-unit.source: The IDS connector creates a “response.html” file in a directory on the server, which is then read and processed from Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: The IDS connector creates a “response.html” file in a directory on the server, which is then read and processed from Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: In the IDS Communication page in Microsoft Dynamics NAV (cc|project > Administration), the raw data files can be viewed and again transformed by action.

seg-source.mrk: In the IDS Communication page in Microsoft Dynamics NAV (cc|project > Administration), the raw data files can be viewed and again transformed by action.

trans-unit.source: Processing Orders with IDS

seg-source.mrk: Processing Orders with IDS

trans-unit.source: The two main functions of processing orders with IDS in cc|project are:

seg-source.mrk: The two main functions of processing orders with IDS in cc|project are:

trans-unit.source: Ordering directly from the Webshop (Quote Calculation)

seg-source.mrk: Ordering directly from the Webshop (Quote Calculation)

trans-unit.source: Creating IDS Basket in Microsoft Dynamics NAV and sending to the Webshop (Procurement)

seg-source.mrk: Creating IDS Basket in Microsoft Dynamics NAV and sending to the Webshop (Procurement)

trans-unit.source: Each function is described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: Each function is described in this section.

trans-unit.source: Order Directly from Webshop

seg-source.mrk: Order Directly from Webshop

trans-unit.source: Typically, IDS is used on the Job Budget Calculation line to create an order directly from the Webshop. This section describes how to start the process of ordering an item using IDS.

seg-source.mrk: Typically, IDS is used on the Job Budget Calculation line to create an order directly from the Webshop.
This section describes how to start the process of ordering an item using IDS.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: All Webshops process information differently in their carts. Therefore, no processing within a Webshop is described in this manual.

seg-source.mrk: All Webshops process information differently in their carts.
Therefore, no processing within a Webshop is described in this manual.

trans-unit.source: Open Webshop from Job Budget Calculation Line

seg-source.mrk: Open Webshop from Job Budget Calculation Line

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to open the Webshop from a Job Budget Calculation line:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to open the Webshop from a Job Budget Calculation line:

trans-unit.source: In the Job Budget Calculation view, create a header line for the Webshop entries.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation view, create a header line for the Webshop entries.

trans-unit.source: Click Actions > IDS - Connector > Open Webshop.

seg-source.mrk: Click Actions > IDS - Connector > Open Webshop.

trans-unit.source: : Opening the Webshop for a line in the Job Budget Calculation view

seg-source.mrk: : Opening the Webshop for a line in the Job Budget Calculation view

trans-unit.source: The IDS Vendor List page opens, with all vendors that have been set up as IDS Vendors (refer to topic “Vendor Card” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: The IDS Vendor List page opens, with all vendors that have been set up as IDS Vendors (refer to topic “Vendor Card” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: : IDS Vendor List

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Vendor List

trans-unit.source: With the correct IDS Vendor selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the correct IDS Vendor selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Accept any messages that appear in regards to the HTML file; the IDS Response Timer dialog will appear and then the IDS Vendor’s Webshop will open in the specified browser.

seg-source.mrk: Accept any messages that appear in regards to the HTML file; the IDS Response Timer dialog will appear and then the IDS Vendor’s Webshop will open in the specified browser.

trans-unit.source: In the Webshop, add item(s) to the cart, enter any additional information, such as shipping and then click the button that transfers the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, e.g. IDS Transfer. At this time, do not place the order along with transferring to IDS, if given the option.

seg-source.mrk: In the Webshop, add item(s) to the cart, enter any additional information, such as shipping and then click the button that transfers the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, e.g. IDS Transfer.
At this time, do not place the order along with transferring to IDS, if given the option.

trans-unit.source: Close the web browser after the order is returned to Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Close the web browser after the order is returned to Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Map IDS Items to Microsoft Dynamics NAV Items

seg-source.mrk: Map IDS Items to Microsoft Dynamics NAV Items

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to map IDS Items to Items in Microsoft Dynamics NAV:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to map IDS Items to Items in Microsoft Dynamics NAV:

trans-unit.source: If the item is not found in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, the IDS Item Mapping page will appear.

seg-source.mrk: If the item is not found in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, the IDS Item Mapping page will appear.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Item Mapping page

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Item Mapping page

trans-unit.source:
In the IDS Item Mapping page, click the lookup in the Action field to select how to map the IDS item to an item in Microsoft Dynamics NAV. The options are:
  • New Item – a new item is created manually based on the value in the New Item No. field. The value in the New Item No. field is the same as the IDS Item No. but can be changed prior to processing the item mapping. If no action is selected, the IDS Item No. is used in the IDS Basket until the item mapping process is performed.
  • New Item from Template – a new item is created automatically from the template indicated in the IDS Setup page
  • Connect to Item – connects the IDS item to an existing item in Microsoft Dynamics NAV

seg-source.mrk: In the IDS Item Mapping page, click the lookup in the Action field to select how to map the IDS item to an item in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
The options are:
• New Item – a new item is created manually based on the value in the New Item No.
field.
The value in the New Item No.
field is the same as the IDS Item No.
but can be changed prior to processing the item mapping.
If no action is selected, the IDS Item No.
is used in the IDS Basket until the item mapping process is performed.
• New Item from Template – a new item is created automatically from the template indicated in the IDS Setup page
• Connect to Item – connects the IDS item to an existing item in Microsoft Dynamics NAV

trans-unit.source: In this example, the New Item from Template option is selected and the Item Template Code and Template Descr. fields are populated with the default from IDS Setup. This template can be changed here as needed.

seg-source.mrk: In this example, the New Item from Template option is selected and the Item Template Code and Template Descr.
fields are populated with the default from IDS Setup.
This template can be changed here as needed.

trans-unit.source: : New item mapping set to be created from default template

seg-source.mrk: : New item mapping set to be created from default template

trans-unit.source:
Click Process Item Mapping.
The item is mapped and the IDS Item Mapping page closes.

seg-source.mrk: Click Process Item Mapping.
The item is mapped and the IDS Item Mapping page closes.

trans-unit.source: Process Webshop Order in Job Line

seg-source.mrk: Process Webshop Order in Job Line

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to process the Webshop order in the Job Budget Calculation line:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to process the Webshop order in the Job Budget Calculation line:

trans-unit.source:
In the Job Budget Calculation view, with the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector. The options that can be used now are:
  • Show Baskets – opens the IDS Baskets page, which lists all baskets for this job and from where the individual IDS Basket pages can be opened
  • Apply Basket – adds the item(s) in the basket to the next level(s) in the job line

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation view, with the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector.
The options that can be used now are:
• Show Baskets – opens the IDS Baskets page, which lists all baskets for this job and from where the individual IDS Basket pages can be opened
• Apply Basket – adds the item(s) in the basket to the next level(s) in the job line

trans-unit.source:
In the Job Budget Calculation view, with the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector. The options that can be used now are:
  • Show Baskets – opens the IDS Baskets page, which lists all baskets for this job and from where the individual IDS Basket pages can be opened
  • Apply Basket – adds the item(s) in the basket to the next level(s) in the job line

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation view, with the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector.
The options that can be used now are:
• Show Baskets – opens the IDS Baskets page, which lists all baskets for this job and from where the individual IDS Basket pages can be opened
• Apply Basket – adds the item(s) in the basket to the next level(s) in the job line

trans-unit.source: : Show and Apply Basket options for Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : Show and Apply Basket options for Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: Click Show Baskets to open the IDS Baskets page.

seg-source.mrk: Click Show Baskets to open the IDS Baskets page.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Baskets page with online shop order

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Baskets page with online shop order

trans-unit.source: Click Edit to open the IDS Basket page.

seg-source.mrk: Click Edit to open the IDS Basket page.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Basket

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Basket

trans-unit.source: The information in the IDS Basket page can be viewed for accuracy before adding to the job line. Click OK to close the IDS Basket page and then close the IDS Baskets page.

seg-source.mrk: The information in the IDS Basket page can be viewed for accuracy before adding to the job line.
Click OK to close the IDS Basket page and then close the IDS Baskets page.

trans-unit.source:
In the Job Budget Calculation view, click IDS - Connector > Apply Basket.
The IDS Baskets page opens.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation view, click IDS - Connector > Apply Basket.
The IDS Baskets page opens.

trans-unit.source: Select the correct basket to apply and then click OK. The item(s) from the basket are added below the header line, with all pricing from the Webshop.

seg-source.mrk: Select the correct basket to apply and then click OK.
The item(s) from the basket are added below the header line, with all pricing from the Webshop.

trans-unit.source: : Basket applied to the Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : Basket applied to the Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: Information about the item – directly from the IDS Vendor’s Webshop – can be accessed by clicking IDS - Connector > Item Info (ADL) in the Job Budget Calculation view. The Webshop will open specifically to the page for the item in the selected job line.

seg-source.mrk: Information about the item – directly from the IDS Vendor’s Webshop – can be accessed by clicking IDS - Connector > Item Info (ADL) in the Job Budget Calculation view.
The Webshop will open specifically to the page for the item in the selected job line.

trans-unit.source: Now that the basket has been applied to the job line, a sales quote can be generated for the customer by clicking Home > Create Sales Quote.

seg-source.mrk: Now that the basket has been applied to the job line, a sales quote can be generated for the customer by clicking Home > Create Sales Quote.

trans-unit.source: : Sales Quote created for job line created from Webshop order

seg-source.mrk: : Sales Quote created for job line created from Webshop order

trans-unit.source: Further processing of the job line can be handled using Job Planning and Processing.

seg-source.mrk: Further processing of the job line can be handled using Job Planning and Processing.

trans-unit.source: Create IDS Basket in Microsoft Dynamics NAV and Send to Webshop

seg-source.mrk: Create IDS Basket in Microsoft Dynamics NAV and Send to Webshop

trans-unit.source: When IDS items exist in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, the items can be added directly to the job lines and then an IDS Basket can be created and sent to the Webshop for order creation. This is the beginning of the procurement process, which is described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: When IDS items exist in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, the items can be added directly to the job lines and then an IDS Basket can be created and sent to the Webshop for order creation.
This is the beginning of the procurement process, which is described in this section.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: All Webshops process information differently in their carts. Therefore, no processing within a Webshop is described in this manual.

seg-source.mrk: All Webshops process information differently in their carts.
Therefore, no processing within a Webshop is described in this manual.

trans-unit.source: Add IDS Items to Job Budget Calculation

seg-source.mrk: Add IDS Items to Job Budget Calculation

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to add IDS items to a Job Budget Calculation:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to add IDS items to a Job Budget Calculation:

trans-unit.source: In the Job Budget Calculation, enter a header line and then manually enter the IDS item(s). Note that the “Item Info (ADL)” function (Actions > IDS - Connector) can be used to access information about the items from the IDS Vendor’s Webshop, such as minimum order quantity requirements.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation, enter a header line and then manually enter the IDS item(s).
Note that the “Item Info (ADL)” function (Actions > IDS - Connector) can be used to access information about the items from the IDS Vendor’s Webshop, such as minimum order quantity requirements.

trans-unit.source: : IDS item added to the Job Budget Calculation

seg-source.mrk: : IDS item added to the Job Budget Calculation

trans-unit.source:
Click Planning and Processing to open the Job Planning and Processing view.
Note that the IDS available check box is selected on the line, as this item has been set up with a cross-reference for an IDS Vendor (refer to topic “Item Cross-References” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Click Planning and Processing to open the Job Planning and Processing view.
Note that the IDS available check box is selected on the line, as this item has been set up with a cross-reference for an IDS Vendor (refer to topic “Item Cross-References” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: : IDS item in Job Planning and Processing view

seg-source.mrk: : IDS item in Job Planning and Processing view

trans-unit.source: On the line for the IDS item, set the Procurement Channel to Order.

seg-source.mrk: On the line for the IDS item, set the Procurement Channel to Order.

trans-unit.source:
With the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector > Create Basket.
The IDS Vendor List page opens.

seg-source.mrk: With the header line selected, click Actions > IDS - Connector > Create Basket.
The IDS Vendor List page opens.

trans-unit.source:
Select the IDS Vendor in which to create the basket and then click OK.
The IDS Basket page opens.

seg-source.mrk: Select the IDS Vendor in which to create the basket and then click OK.
The IDS Basket page opens.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Basket with IDS item from Job Planning and Processing lines

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Basket with IDS item from Job Planning and Processing lines

trans-unit.source: Click Send Basket. The IDS Response Time dialog will appear and then the IDS Vendor’s Webshop opens to the cart for processing.

seg-source.mrk: Click Send Basket.
The IDS Response Time dialog will appear and then the IDS Vendor’s Webshop opens to the cart for processing.

trans-unit.source: In the Webshop, enter any additional information, such as shipping, and then click the button that transfers the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV as well as places the order, e.g. IDS Transfer & Order.

seg-source.mrk: In the Webshop, enter any additional information, such as shipping, and then click the button that transfers the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV as well as places the order, e.g. IDS Transfer & Order.

trans-unit.source: Close the web browser after the order is returned to Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Close the web browser after the order is returned to Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Plan and Release Procurement

seg-source.mrk: Plan and Release Procurement

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to plan and release the procurement for the IDS item:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to plan and release the procurement for the IDS item:

trans-unit.source: A new IDS Basket is created for the online order, with a return message and order number displayed in the General FastTab, as well as the Procurement Status set to Open.

seg-source.mrk: A new IDS Basket is created for the online order, with a return message and order number displayed in the General FastTab, as well as the Procurement Status set to Open.

trans-unit.source: : Return basket order from IDS Vendor’s Webshop

seg-source.mrk: : Return basket order from IDS Vendor’s Webshop

trans-unit.source: Click Release Procurement to plan and release the procurement for this basket in the job line.

seg-source.mrk: Click Release Procurement to plan and release the procurement for this basket in the job line.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to release the Job Procurement Lines for the Basket Lines.

seg-source.mrk: Click Yes to release the Job Procurement Lines for the Basket Lines.

trans-unit.source:
Click Yes to create Procurement Documents.
The Procurement Status is changed to Released in the IDS Basket page.

seg-source.mrk: Click Yes to create Procurement Documents.
The Procurement Status is changed to Released in the IDS Basket page.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Basket with updated Procurement Status

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Basket with updated Procurement Status

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the IDS Basket page and return to the Job Planning and Processing view. Note that the Procurement Release and Purchase Order fields are set to Yes.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the IDS Basket page and return to the Job Planning and Processing view.
Note that the Procurement Release and Purchase Order fields are set to Yes.

trans-unit.source: : Released procurement line with purchase order

seg-source.mrk: : Released procurement line with purchase order

trans-unit.source:
Click the value in the Purchase Order field to open the purchase order.
Note that the IDS Purchase Order check box is selected in the General FastTab, which indicates that the order was created from an IDS order. This field is transferred to the Purchase Order to the Purchase Receipt Header, Purchase Invoice Header and Purchase Credit Memo Header upon posting.

seg-source.mrk: Click the value in the Purchase Order field to open the purchase order.
Note that the IDS Purchase Order check box is selected in the General FastTab, which indicates that the order was created from an IDS order.
This field is transferred to the Purchase Order to the Purchase Receipt Header, Purchase Invoice Header and Purchase Credit Memo Header upon posting.

trans-unit.source: : Purchase Order created for IDS Webshop order

seg-source.mrk: : Purchase Order created for IDS Webshop order

trans-unit.source: Integration to Requisition Worksheets

seg-source.mrk: Integration to Requisition Worksheets

trans-unit.source: Items from IDS can be transferred from the Job Planning and Processing view to the Requisition Worksheet. However, action messages are carried out from an IDS Basket, not the Requisition Worksheet.

seg-source.mrk: Items from IDS can be transferred from the Job Planning and Processing view to the Requisition Worksheet.
However, action messages are carried out from an IDS Basket, not the Requisition Worksheet.

trans-unit.source: : IDS item in Job Planning and Processing view sent to the Requisition Worksheet

seg-source.mrk: : IDS item in Job Planning and Processing view sent to the Requisition Worksheet

trans-unit.source: When processing IDS through the requisition worksheet, an IDS Basket must be created to finish processing the order. On the Actions tab, click IDS - Connector > Create Basket. Select the IDS Vendor as previously shown, and then click Send Basket to open the webshop.

seg-source.mrk: When processing IDS through the requisition worksheet, an IDS Basket must be created to finish processing the order.
On the Actions tab, click IDS - Connector > Create Basket.
Select the IDS Vendor as previously shown, and then click Send Basket to open the webshop.

trans-unit.source: : IDS Basket with IDS item from Job Planning and Processing lines ready to send to Webshop

seg-source.mrk: : IDS Basket with IDS item from Job Planning and Processing lines ready to send to Webshop

trans-unit.source: As previously described, enter any additional information in the Webshop, and then transfer the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: As previously described, enter any additional information in the Webshop, and then transfer the information back to IDS in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: A new IDS Basket is returned with a Basket Source = Online Shop, a return message, order confirmation number and the Procurement Status set to Open.

seg-source.mrk: A new IDS Basket is returned with a Basket Source = Online Shop, a return message, order confirmation number and the Procurement Status set to Open.

trans-unit.source: : Return basket order from IDS Vendor’s Webshop, ready to carry out action message

seg-source.mrk: : Return basket order from IDS Vendor’s Webshop, ready to carry out action message

trans-unit.source: The order can now be processed directly from the IDS Basket by clicking Carry Out Action Message.

seg-source.mrk: The order can now be processed directly from the IDS Basket by clicking Carry Out Action Message.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: The “Carry Out Action Message” function in the Requisition Worksheet cannot be used for IDS Webshop orders.

seg-source.mrk: The “Carry Out Action Message” function in the Requisition Worksheet cannot be used for IDS Webshop orders.
